name: Retail
roles: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO), VP/Director of Marketing, Brand Director, Retail Marketing Manager, Head of Retail Marketing, Product Marketing Manager, Consumer Insights Manager
industry: Retail (multi-location: grocery, big-box, specialty, department stores, e-commerce)
description: Retail marketers leading omnichannel campaigns across multi-location stores, franchises, and e-commerce. Collaborative and results-oriented, seeking measurable growth and strategic differentiation.
goals: Support product launches and seasonal campaigns
pain_points: Standing out in competitive retail categories
Aligning with merchandising and business goals
Managing rapid shifts in consumer behavior
communication_style: Professional, concise, and data-driven. Prefers honest, realistic conversations and clear reporting.
engagement_preferences: Open to retainer or project-based work. Expects nimble, consultative, and collaborative agencies.
decision_making: Multi-stakeholder: includes marketing, finance, operations, and procurement

name: Restaurant
roles: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO), VP/Director of Marketing, Head of Brand, Senior Marketing Manager, Director of Marketing, Regional Marketing Manager
description: Restaurant marketers from QSR, casual dining, and franchise systems. Operate in fast-paced environments and value agile, strategic agency partners with hospitality fluency.
pain_points: Frustration with slow or rigid agencies
communication_style: Fast-paced, direct, and tactical. Prefers rapid iteration and realistic planning with clear results.
engagement_preferences: Open to flexible service models. Prioritizes speed, relevance, and operational alignment.
decision_making: Collaborative with marketing, ops, finance, and franchisee leadership

name: Healthcare
roles: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO), VP/Director of Marketing, Brand Manager, Director of Marketing
industry: Healthcare (hospital systems, IDNs, urgent care, behavioral health, specialty practices)
description: Healthcare marketers at hospitals, IDNs, urgent care, and behavioral health systems. Operate under strict compliance and seek agencies fluent in both strategy and regulation.
communication_style: Evidence-based and collaborative. Expects clear, compliant messaging and proactive reporting.
triggers: New service lines or facility launches
engagement_preferences: Retainer or project-based. Must be nimble, proactive, and fully HIPAA-compliant.
decision_making: Led by marketing with input from procurement, executive leadership, and physicians

name: Franchise
roles: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO), VP/Director of Marketing, Franchise Marketing Manager, Brand Manager, Director of Marketing, Regional Marketing Manager
description: Franchise marketers who navigate national branding with local activation. Require deep stakeholder alignment and field marketing fluency.
pain_points: Balancing national branding with local needs
communication_style: Strategic, pragmatic, and detail-driven. Values agencies with field experience and co-op expertise.
engagement_preferences: Seeks agency partners, not vendors. Emphasis on co-op clarity and scalable collaboration.
decision_making: Involves marketing, field teams, franchisee councils, legal, finance
